On Feb 3, 2010, at 10:55 AM, Gordon Mohr wrote:

> Derek Pappas wrote (offlist, but was OK with an on-list reply):
>> Gordon,
>>
>> You may or may not be interested to see what the Hertrix traffic  
>> pattern
>> looks like over a two week period.
>> All four crawlers were restarted two weeks ago.
>>
>> There are 4 computers running crawlers and the traffic pattern slows
>> over time even though the queue size is increasing.
> [screenshot of H1 console and of bandwidth graph was attached]
>
> It's normal for the rate to slow, for a variety of different reasons.
> But that rate (<10 URI/sec) is suspiciously slow for having so many
> independent queues to crawl (load factor 16+), and all threads (50)  
> active.
>

And that is what we are observing on the other machines.
One has slowed down to .35 URI's/sec

> What's the hardware like?
>

model name	:                   Intel(R) Xeon(TM) CPU 3.00GHz
stepping	: 3
cpu MHz		: 3000.190
cache size	: 2048 KB

$ cat /proc/meminfo
MemTotal:      1026792 kB
MemFree:          7908 kB
Buffers:          8316 kB
Cached:         303852 kB
SwapCached:          0 kB
Active:         755180 kB
Inactive:       204024 kB
HighTotal:           0 kB
HighFree:            0 kB
LowTotal:      1026792 kB
LowFree:          7908 kB
SwapTotal:     4200988 kB
SwapFree:      4200904 kB
Dirty:           78300 kB
Writeback:           0 kB
AnonPages:      647044 kB
Mapped:          37904 kB
Slab:            29260 kB
PageTables:      13612 kB
NFS_Unstable:        0 kB
Bounce:              0 kB
CommitLimit:   4714384 kB
Committed_AS:  1120052 kB
VmallocTotal: 34359738367 kB
VmallocUsed:    264716 kB
VmallocChunk: 34359473267 kB
HugePages_Total:     0
HugePages_Free:      0
HugePages_Rsvd:      0
Hugepagesize:     2048 kB

We have observed the same slow down on quadcores and core 2duos.


> Might the machine be swapping?
>

SwapTotal:     4200988 kB
SwapFree:      4200904 kB


> Are there other busy/memory-intensive processes active on the same  
> machine?
>

No.

> Could a majority of the sites targeted by live queues be not  
> responding
> to your connect requests, and thus encountering both slow (20-30  
> second)
> socket timeouts, and slow (15 minute) retry cycles? This could be the
> case if sites have explicitly blocked your IP,

This is the first time that we have crawled these sites.

> or if you've hit a large
> collection of related trap sites (such as wildcard subdomains) that  
> are
> all unresponsive/intentionally-slow. The frontier report provides the
> best clues if this is happening.

I will check this out.

>
> Also, the 'out' bandwidth is *so* smooth for long periods that there
> could be a cap or other traffic shaping on some overburdened link
> between the machine and the net.

I will check this out
We capped it at 20mbs and are running under the cap.


>
> - Gordon
